appendix.title: Common Syntax
appendix.para: Throughout the ⪚ Administrative Interface, Administrators must enter information about their network and web locations. In some cases the values entered can be exact, and others the text entered indicates a range of values. We cover the various syntaxes used throughout the Administrative Interface in this appendix.

simplesect.title: Simple IP Address Syntax
simplesect.para: The Simple IP Address syntax is an exact IP address. Examples include: 192.168.10.1 66.94.230.42

simplesect.title: Network/Netmask Syntax
simplesect.para:
The Network/Netmask syntax is used to define an IP Address and netmask with a single value. Examples include:
192.168.1.1/24 66.94.230.42/16
The format is <IP Address>/<number> where <IP Address> is an IP address. <number> is a number between 0 and 32. This second value is short hand for a netmask, defining the number of leading one's when expressed in bit form. For example, the mask 255.255.255.0 can be expressed as /24 and the mask 255.255.0.0 can be expressed as /16.

simplesect.title: IP Range Syntax
simplesect.para:
The IP Range syntax defines a collection of contiguious IP Addresses. It is expressed as address-address, where a dash (-) is used to separate the ends of the range. Examples include: 192.168.10.1-192.168.10.100 66.94.230.1-66.94.230.100
In many cases, IP Range Syntax and Network/Netmask Syntax can be used interchangably.

simplesect.title: IP Matcher Syntax
simplesect.para: The IP Matcher syntax is used in several components within the ⪚. It is the most powerful means to express a range of IP Addresses. Where a field within the Administrative Interface specifies IP Matcher Syntax, one can enter values in either Simple IP Address, Network/Netmask, or IP Range Syntax.

In addition to the other supported syntaxes, fields in the IP Matcher Syntax also understand the literal strings local and any. The value any matches any address. The value local is used when referring to traffic arriving on the external interface of ⪚, and means any external address hosted by the ⪚ machine.

simplesect.title: Simple Port Syntax
simplesect.para: The Simple Port is a port number without expressing range. It is a number between 0 and 65,535.

simplesect.title: Port Range Syntax
simplesect.para:
The Port Range syntax defines a collection of contiguious ports. It is expressed as port-port, where a dash (-) is used to separate the ends of the range. port is a number between 0 and 65,535. Examples include:
1024-2048 20-26

simplesect.title: Port Matcher Syntax
simplesect.para: The Port Matcher syntax is used in several components within the ⪚. It is the most powerful means to express a range of ports. Where a field within the Administrative Interface specifies Port Matcher Syntax, one can enter values in either Simple Port or Port Range Syntax.
In addition to the other supported syntaxes, fields in the Port Matcher Syntax also understand the literal string any, where the value any matches all ports.
